desc: PRKCI, a serine/threonine kinase, is frequently altered by amplification across various cancers.

The PRKCI gene encodes the protein kinase C iota, an atypical serine/threonine kinase involved in multiple cellular processes. PRKCI protects BCR-ABL leukemia cells from undergoing apoptosis (PMID: 9346882). It also enhances cell proliferation and survival via NF-KB pathway activation (PMID: 10467349, 10356400). PRKCI promotes colony formation and tumor growth in vivo (PMID: 15994303) and cooperates with SOX2 to activate the Hedgehog signaling pathway in lung cancers (PMID: 24525231). PRKCI phosphorylates BAD in glioma cells, thus allowing them to evade apoptosis (PMID: 21419810). PRKCI is frequently altered by amplification in several cancers, including lung, ovarian, esophageal and head and neck carcinomas (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Dec. 2016).
